isis.stitle: ELECTRONIC ENGINE CONTROLS - CATERPILLAR 3176 - 1992 - 1993 - TROUBLESHOOTING - TESTING HELLA RELAY

svcproc.title: TESTING HELLA RELAY
svcproc.para: International circuits use suppressed Hella relays (1672537C1) for controlling power to load devices ( Figure 5.01). The suppression feature (a resistor circuit parallel to the relay coil) prevents voltage spikes from damaging electronic components in the vehicle. These relays must be replaced with the correct International part.

figure.caption: Figure 5.01 - Relay Function And Wiring Guide

svcproc.para: The part number is embossed on the relay. There is also a circuit diagram of the relay located on the relay body. The terminals are numbered on the relay in the same manner as in the circuit diagrams. To test the relay use the following steps:

step1.para: With the relay removed, measure resistance between relay coil terminals 85 and 86 (coil resistance). The resistance should be approximately 72 ohms.

step2.para: If resistance is correct, go to step 2.
If resistance is not correct, replace the relay.

step1.para: Measure resistance between relay common terminal 30 and normally closed terminal 87A. Resistance should be less than 1.0 ohm.

step2.para: If resistance is less than 1.0 ohms, go to step 3.
If resistance is more than 1.0 ohms, replace the relay.

step1.para: Using 12V battery source and test leads, apply 12V across relay terminals 85 and 86. (The relay should make an audible click.) Use ohmmeter and measure resistance between the relay common terminal 30 and normally open terminal 87, while the relay is energized. Resis- tance should be 1.0 ohms or less.

step2.para: If resistance is 1.0 ohms or less, go to step 4.
If resistance is more than 1.0 ohms, replace the relay.

step1.para: With the relay energized (from step 3), measure resistance across relay common terminal 30 and normally closed terminal 87A. Resistance should be 100K ohms or more.

step2.para: If resistance is 100K ohms or more, the relay tests good.
If resistance is less than 100K ohms, replace the relay.
